text: this is the heart of Delhi's backpacker
district where hundreds of tourists come
every year and it was in one of hotels
around here that the Danish woman was
staying there probably though many
tourists who will think it could have
been them suffering this traumatic
experience where she reportedly told
police that when she tried to get
directions to come home the men she'd
gone to reportedly attacked her and then
robbed her and now yet again what's
happened here has highlighted the whole
issue of women's safety now campaigners
say that although laws have been
tightened since the Delhi gang-rape case
of just over a year ago there's much
more attention on this issue there still
needs to be a lot more done to help
women Indian women across the country if
you're in a place like Delhi a rape case
is gonna get a lot more attention but in
the rural areas where most Indians live
still women's have a pretty raw deal but
right now because this case is getting
so much attention they're concerned
about the effect on tourism revenues the
Delhi Police are putting a lot of effort
into trying to solve this case
